title: Fence Regulations
summary: Fence height and placement rules vary by zone and location on property.

permit_requirements.when_required: Fences over 6 feet in any location
permit_requirements.when_not_required: Fences 6 feet or under meeting setback requirements
permit_requirements.historic_district: All exterior work requires Certificate of Appropriateness

front_yard.notes: Measured from grade at fence location

side_yard_front_portion.description: Side yard between front building line and street

side_yard_rear_portion.description: Side yard behind front building line

corner_lot.notes: Street-facing sides treated as front yard

from_property_line.notes: Can be built on property line, but check survey first

vision_clearance.description: At intersections and driveways, fences over 30 inches must be set back
vision_clearance.triangle: Sight triangle typically 25 feet on each side

material_requirements.maintenance: Fences must be maintained in good condition, not leaning or falling

variance_process.when_needed: To exceed height limits or other requirements

non_compliant_fence.fine: Up to $500 per day after notice period

common_questions.good_side_facing: No requirement, but neighborly to face good side out
common_questions.neighbor_consent: Not required if on your property, but recommended to discuss
common_questions.shared_fence: Both owners responsible for maintenance if on property line
